score.explanation: Your Wi-Fi connection is generally stable but impacted by congestion from nearby networks.
score.trend_summary: Since last scan: download worsened, upload stayed the same, ping improved, networks increased.

latest_report.diagnosis: Your Wi-Fi connection shows signs of congestion, particularly on the 2.4GHz band, likely causing the reported dropouts.

performance.interpretation: The download speed is decent, but occasional dropouts may affect online activities, such as gaming.

problems: High congestion on 2.4GHz band causing interference and dropouts.
Multiple nearby networks on overlapping channels.
Suboptimal router placement affecting signal strength.
Inadequate upload speed for potential video conferencing or gaming.
fixes: Change your 2.4GHz channel to 1 for better performance (less congested).
Set your 5GHz channel to 149, as it has less interference than 36.
Consider moving the router closer to the center of your home to reduce dropout issues.
Enable Band Steering if supported, to optimize device connections.
Limit the number of devices connected when high bandwidth is needed, especially during gaming sessions.
